programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman suddenly becomes critically ill, eventually leaving her unable to walk. A bone marrow test reveals the cause: arsenic. Investigators must determine if the poisoning was caused by groundwater contamination or something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The decomposed body of a young woman was discovered in a Bakersfield irrigation canal. If there was trace evidence, it had been washed away.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an eccentric millionaire was not entirely unexpected; he flaunted his wealth and cared little for personal security. The evidence at the crime seemed to indicate robbery, but investigators wondered if there was something more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators sift through the ashes of a fire which killed a 40-year-old woman. The fire appeared to have been started by an unattended cigarette. On closer look, forensic scientists discover the cause was far more complicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bruce Miller was shot to death in the office of the junkyard business he owned. The crime scene was almost pristine. When a computer forensics expert examined the computers owned by the victim's wife and her lover, he found all the evidence needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 investigation into 48-year-old Martha Hansen's murder in Anchorage is helped by a legal requirement that bars have video cameras installed on the premises. Using video, hair and blood evidence, investigators determine that Evans Lee Curtis was the murderer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: No one in a quiet residential community saw anything unusual the day one of their neighbors was brutally attacked and murdered. Fingerprints found at the crime scene and surveillance video helped investigators to apprehend the presumed killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1962, the people of the small town of Hanford, California lost their sense of peace when one of their own, 15-year-old Marlene Miller, was murdered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A patrol officer is shocked by the amount of blood at a traffic accident and is shocked by the coroner's ruling until an anonymous phone call re-ignites the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three seemingly unrelated deaths proved to be serial murders. The killer had been careful _ he used poison which had no taste or odor. Fortunately for investigators, it also had a unique chemical signature.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a wealthy real estate tycoon went missing, it appeared to be foul play. In his will, he left instructions regarding what was to happen if he died under violent circumstances_which were carried out after a hiker came across a bullet-ridden skull.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Computers aid the police and FBI in solving a string of crimes in St. Louis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A suspicious fire swept through an apartment killing two young women. The cause of the fire and the identity of the victims were unclear. But a closer look at the fire scene revealed something hidden in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2002, a small community in upstate New York was devastated when Patty Wlasiuk died in a truck accident. But burdock seed pods found in her hair and on her clothes would indicate that this was no accident. It was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murders of an elderly couple leave police stumped until, two years later, they receive a major break. A jeweler looking through old newspaper clippings recognizes a necklace the female victim wore as having been pawned in her own shop.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a wealthy American businessman was found in his rental car. Teeth and bone fragments were the only remains. When the victim's wife files an insurance claim for $7 million, investigators seek the help of a renowned forensic anthropologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A union official is executed in his home not long after a strike by the union membership. Neither his wife nor anyone in the neighborhood heard any gunshots. It would take a forensic sound test, an electron microscope, and a nightgown to explain why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors cannot pinpoint the source of a businessman's illness.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murder investigation in St. Petersburg, Florida, crosses jurisdictions from New York and Jamaica. The police rely on cell phone mapping, wiretapping and a host of forensic evidence to link a suspect to a murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Firefighters found an entire family dead inside their home, it seemed like a murder-suicide. But there were several inconsistent clues in the rubble. Could ballistics, a time card, and some secret audiotapes unravel the mystery?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was 1957, and California police were searching for a man who had committed several crimes in one night, including murder. They followed thousands of leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators proved an old adage: You can run, but you can't hide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A healthy young man dies mysteriously in his sleep, and toxicology tests reveal a lethal dose of lidocaine in his blood. Investigators find a suicide note, and presume he killed himself until a forensic linguist examines the note.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three seemingly unrelated deaths proved to be serial murders. The killer had been careful _ he used poison which had no taste or odor. Fortunately for investigators, it also had a unique chemical signature.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: 1984 Rajneeshee bioterror attack: investigators uncover a plot to overthrow the government after a unique strain of salmonella makes people ill.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Genell Plude is found dead in her bathroom, the scene points to suicide. But a coroner's inquest and a unique application of forensic science gave investigators a different explanation for her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A talented television news anchor was shot to death outside her home; it appeared to be a crime of passion, perpetrated by an obsessed fan.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man died in his home after a long history of heart disease. It was assumed that this was the cause of his death. A few weeks after the funeral, rumors surfaced that the death was no accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Sheila Bryan, who was convicted of killing her mother in a car fire, is granted a new trial. An expert fire witness's opinion on how the fire ignited differs from the prosecution's theory. If verified, it would clear Bryan of any culpability.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police were puzzled by an obscure print found at a crime scene where one man had been killed and two teenage girls were seriously injured. Neither of the girls could identify their attacker. But one simple clue helped track the footsteps of a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman's death in Pennsylvania triggers a homicide investigation into another woman's death in North Carolina. The similarities in the cases were striking, and examiners must determine if the suspect's story about accidental drowning is all wet.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a pipe bomb ripped through a rural home, police had no idea who was responsible. A lot number on a 9-volt battery and the remnants of a mailing label found on a hard drive led investigators to who sent the bomb and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into a brutal attack on two boys near a pond relies on evidence fished out of the murky water. It was the first case where Diatom evidence was used to place a suspect at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of 9-year-old Jessica Knott is investigated. Investigators use a garbage bag to connect suspect James Edward Crow, Jr. to the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The sensitive nose of a forensic examiner sniffs out murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the state of Florida was known for more than just Disney World. Worldwide attention focused on a rash of robberies which targeted tourists. Some vacationers were killed in these attacks, but some fought and survived, despite severe injuries.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The news of a flight attendant's brutal murder prompted the son of a victim who had been killed five years earlier to contact police. Both murders had similar MOs, and analysis of biological evidence proved that these were serial killings.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A suspicious fire swept through an apartment killing two young women. The cause of the fire and the identity of the victims were unclear. But a closer look at the fire scene revealed something hidden in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.desc: The plot to take control of Southfork gets complicated. Christopher and Elena bury their feelings to work together on a business deal, but Rebecca may be hiding her own secrets.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: J.R. decides to move back to Southfork, much to Ann's dismay. Bitter Ewing family enemy Cliff Barnes (KEN KERCHEVAL -- Dallas [original series]) returns.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross seeks to gain an upper hand on a family member and resorts to blackmail. Christopher opens up to Bobby about his difficulty in choosing between the two women he loves.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Family ties begin to unravel when the deed to Southfork is revealed. Ann seeks help from someone in her past and Christopher decides it is time to fight dirty.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross decides to move into Southfork. Rebecca approaches Bobby and Christopher with information that she believes might help save the ranch. MITCH PILEGGI guest stars.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Rebecca reveals a life-changing secret to Elena. Meanwhile, John Ross tries to turn one family member against another and a family associate is murdered.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Christopher moves closer to his dream when a large oil company approaches him about rights to new methane technology. And the Ewings fight to protect Southfork from outsiders.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross learns the value of family when he must choose between blood and oil. Sue Ellen and Rebecca both find themselves victims of men who could destroy their lives.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: In the dramatic season one finale, Christopher and Elena begin to learn that not everyone is as they appear to be. Long-buried secrets are revealed as the past rears its ugly head.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: In the second season premiere, as Christopher seeks to gain the upper hand in his divorce from Rebecca Sutter, a game-changing revelation turns everything on its head.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Pamela Rebecca Barnes schemes with John Ross to fulfill her father's desire for revenge. Ryland's mother (JUDITH LIGHT) proves just as evil as her son.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Pamela pushes her father's agenda to gain control of Ewing Energies. As a new member of the family arrives at Southfork, Ann is pushed to the brink by Ryland's sadistic games.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: J.R. works to undermine Pamela, forcing John Ross to choose between a Ewing and a Barnes. Cliff Barnes (KEN KERCHEVAL) returns to meet with an unlikely visitor.

programme.title: Bloomberg: The Close
programme.desc: Alix Steel, Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu own the market-moving breaking news around the closing bell; a synthesis of the top stories; key insights from investors, strategists and the companies of today and tomorrow.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance of Power
programme.desc: Focusing on the intersection of politics and global business.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Asia Trade

programme.title: Bloomberg: The China Show
programme.desc: From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors insight into the world's second-biggest economy, delivering in-depth discussions with newsmakers.

programme.title: The David Rubenstein Show: Peer to Peer Conversations
programme.desc: Financier and philanthropist David Rubenstein talks with his peers who leaders of some of America's biggest companies.

programme.title: Bloomberg Screentime: The Business of Pop Culture
programme.desc: The icons and innovators behind today's entertainment revolution take the stage. The agenda: AI's creative takeover, the streaming wars, and what's next for legacy media. Guests include: Jimmy Kimmel, David Ellison, Adam Mosseri, Greg Peters.

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day. With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa. Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping the decisions of traders across the Middle East, Africa and beyond.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe

programme.title: Bloomberg The Opening Trade
programme.desc: The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.title: Desierto adentro
programme.desc: Un hombre ha cometido un gran pecado contra Dios y está convencido de que sobre sus hijos caerá la condena de una muerte prematura.

programme.title: Vico C: la vida del filósofo
programme.desc: La historia del cantante Vico C, compositor y pionero de la música urbana en español, desde sus inicios hasta su éxito internacional.

programme.title: Prisión de por vida (Doblado)
programme.desc: Al obtener la libertad condicional, Tony intenta cambiar su vida y convertirse en un mejor padre, pero esto resulta ser un desafío.

programme.title: Ladies Buchonas
programme.desc: Una mujer busca satisfacción fuera de su relación con un mafioso, pero debe permanecer en silencio sobre su búsqueda si quiere seguir con vida.

programme.title: Identity Theft (Español)
programme.desc: Un valet roba la identidad de un moribundo para cambiar su vida, pero, sin saberlo, su nueva oportunidad podría llevarlo a la ruina.

programme.title: Bodas de muertos
programme.desc: Después de terribles desgracias, una mujer es internada en un sanatorio pero tiene la lucidez suficiente para escapar y vengar a sus seres queridos.

programme.title: Cometa
programme.desc: Un chico pierde todas las cosas que lo motivan a vivir. Se ha quedado sin trabajo, casa y familia, pero en su recorrido por las calles se encuentra a Cometa, un perro callejero.

programme.title: Las viejas del sicario
programme.desc: Una película de acción de narcos.

programme.title: Dos monjitas en peligro
programme.desc: Dos mujeres deciden ayudar al orfanato donde trabaja su tía, pero un mafioso las obliga a colaborar con el narcotráfico usando su hábito religioso.

programme.title: Jesus
programme.desc: La trayectoria de Jesucristo antes de la resurrección. Sus milagros y el calvario de la cruz. Las vidas de quienes fueron curados por Jesucristo y quiénes eran los apóstoles.

programme.title: Hijos del Monte
programme.desc: Cinco hermanos viven una vida tranquila en el fundo Rinconada del Monte, encargándose de cuidar del próspero fundo, legado de su padres, pero todo cambia cuando se lee el testamento, iniciándose una ruptura y el inicio de una nueva historia.

programme.title: La tierra prometida
programme.desc: Historia bíblica que sigue a Josué mientras lidera a los hebreos hacia Canaán. Josué enfrenta diversos desafíos, incluyendo la oposición de Samara, quien está enamorada de él.

programme.title: La hoguera de la ambición
programme.desc: Una familia adinerada se desmorona cuando sus miembros comienzan una furiosa batalla por el reparto de sus riquezas.

programme.title: Génesis
programme.desc: El faraón padece una extraña enfermedad en la piel y se entera de que Saraí es esposa de Abraham. Saraí le informa a su esposo que el faraón ya sabe la verdad y que seguramente deberán partir. Un asesinato se lleva a cabo en silencio.

programme.title: Señora del Destino
programme.desc: Maria do Carmo es una madre de cinco hijos que triunfó en la vida con mucha lucha y tesón pero que todavía tendrá una batalla que luchar: obtener el cariño de su hija quien fue secuestrada cuando era una recién nacida.

programme.title: Jesus
programme.desc: La trayectoria de Jesucristo antes de la resurrección. Sus milagros y el calvario de la cruz. Las vidas de quienes fueron curados por Jesucristo y quiénes eran los apóstoles.

programme.title: Hijos del Monte

programme.title: La tierra prometida

programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Local radio personality, Greg Adams, wants to shine a light on all parts of his beloved city and prove that Milwaukee has a lot more to offer than people might expect. In each episode, Greg is joined by a notable personality from the community who shows him their favorite spots and the best ways to experience them.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On January 9, 2018, a massive debris flow tore through Montecito, becoming one of California’s deadliest natural disasters. But as families and first responders face unthinkable loss, stories of hope rise to unite this coastal community.

programme.title: LIVE: WISN 12 News
programme.desc: The latest news, weather, and sports from the WISN 12 News team.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Love hurts: These are real-life stories of Americans who were swindled by people who claimed to love them.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Pour wine out of a wall, solve a murder over dinner and make friends at one of the many music venues in this cozy PA county.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Glenda Macatangay has conquered her career and being a single mom to four kids. But when it comes to being comfortable in the outdoors, she isn’t as confident. Kinga meets up with Glenda in Sacramento, CA to introduce her to the wonders of the wilderness.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Three-year-old Kamille McKinney, affectionately known as "Cupcake," is abducted while playing outside a relative's Birmingham home. The ensuing search unifies the city, as residents pray she will be found alive.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: In Birmingham, the guys spark joy with a pizza party, dice games, and small surprises for unhoused neighbors. A mother with MS shares her dream of racing with her family by her side, and a man facing amputation receives a life-changing wheelchair.

programme.desc: The latest news, weather, and sports from the KCCI 8 News Team.

programme.desc: From a para track and field star, to members of an elite octogenarian rowing team and a once-in-a-generation female quarterback, these groundbreaking athletes are 'Boston Strong.'

programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch travels the country to bring you heartwarming stories about the people and places that make America so special.

programme.title: Refugees Welcome: A Story of Immigration to America’s Heartland
programme.desc: Refugees Welcome documents how one Governor’s brave decision to welcome refugees during the Vietnam War had far reaching repercussions not only for the country but, generations later, for the fate of his own family.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: In this battle, it’s a head chef showdown. Chef Brandon Basista of Bearded Chef food truck faces off with Chef Alex Diaz of Alex’s Fresh Kitchen in Casselberry. It's a battle of the beards on this episode of Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Explore a historic cave with timeless messages on its walls. Savor every last crumb of a Cookie Monster waffle. Test your putt-putt skills on a hole designed to get the better of you.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin, Ryan and Tony introduce us to a real-life superhero who has opened her home and heart to special needs children.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: Tourists might love Orlando, but nobody loves it quite like our local experts. They’’ll show you where to satisfy your hunger with Biggie’s Bomb-Mi sandwich, watch someone else feed a gator, and eat from the garden of Eden.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: From a skier who turned her tragedy into the state's biggest charity event, to a cyclist who energizes others with maple syrup, you can't take the "Vermont" out of Burlington athletes.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Watch Rob howl like a wolf, chill out with African penguins and go horseback riding in this episode celebrating the natural world.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Baking and confections are a science. These Greenville sweet spots, Brick Street Cafe, Buttermilk Sky Pie, Better Than Sex, and Old Europe Cafe show us how they get the chemistry in their flavors exactly right!

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Big City Chef Hish Hassan from Chickadees in Boston takes on Small town Chef J. Huntington Chase of The Rabbit Hole in Worthington in an explosion of flavors and techniques. Who will prevail in this Urban vs Rural showdown?

programme.title: Plate It!
